alert.note: Alert for Coastal Georgetown; Inland Georgetown; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 2:29PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Georgetown and southeastern Williamsburg Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 229 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sampit, or 11 miles northwest of Georgetown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Pawleys Island, Murrells Inlet, Yawkey South Island, Winyah Bay Entrance, Andrews, North Santee, Warsaw, Oatland, Lambert, Sampit, Plantersville, Graves, Earle, Litchfield Beach, Waccamaw Community Hospital and Georgetown Memorial Hospital. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
